name: Service Desk & Systems
description: Keywords around service desk functionalities, ITIL practices, and software integrations.

llm_rationales.authority: Very high. 'Service desk & systems' is a foundational topic in the support space and is broad enough to cover many concepts. A great 'hub' topic.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: ServiceNow is a competitor. While addressing the topic can showcase advantages, it’s not a core offering of Donkey Support.

cluster_notes: Good cluster, but potentially merge with clusters 2 or 9 if volume is low

name: Dynamics Integration & Support
description: Keywords specifically relating to integrating Dynamics 365 with other systems and providing software support.

llm_rationales.authority: Good depth, but quite specific. It doesn't establish broad expertise. Relies heavily on the 'Software Support Channels' topic for context.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Dynamics 365 integration is relevant to some ICPs, but a smaller segment. Doesn’t naturally lead to Donkey Support’s core offering (multi-platform integration).

cluster_notes: Niche but strong enough to stand alone.

name: Software & Support Queries
description: Keywords related to obtaining quotes for software services, finding support, and CRM for nonprofits.

llm_rationales.authority: Useful for understanding the buyer journey, but not central to establishing expertise.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Software service quotes are focused on pricing, a later-stage consideration. Doesn't strongly highlight the value proposition of integrated support.

cluster_notes: [needs_serp_validation] Mix of pricing, support, and niche use case (nonprofits). Could be split.

name: Customer Support Process
description: Keywords centering around the processes involved in customer support, including SLAs and ticket handling.

llm_rationales.authority: Very High. Understanding customer support processes is foundational knowledge for anyone in the field.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Describes the *process* of customer support. Doesn’t inherently highlight Donkey Support’s value.

cluster_notes: Slightly broad, but coherent enough to address in a single piece.

name: SaaS Support Definitions
description: Keywords relating to defining and understanding SaaS customer support, including IT service management.

llm_rationales.authority: Strong foundational element. Defines the landscape Donkey Support operates in. Good for introductory content.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Defining SaaS support is helpful for context, but doesn’t directly showcase Donkey Support’s unique benefits.

cluster_notes: Covers core concepts of SaaS support.

name: Company Support Contacts
description: Keywords used to find specific company support channels (e.g., Ariel, Saw).

llm_rationales.authority: Good. Addresses a common user need. Could serve as a good resource.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: People looking for product support pages likely need help, and Donkey Support can provide that help.

cluster_notes: [needs_serp_validation] This is purely navigational. Each company should have its own dedicated resource, and this cluster should be broken down by brand.

name: Technical Support & Desk
description: Keywords relating to technical support, service desk functionalities, and response times.

llm_rationales.authority: Very High.  Understanding key support metrics like response time is critical for establishing authority.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Help desk response time is a pain point Donkey Support addresses but doesn't directly define the product. More of a problem statement.

cluster_notes: Focused on practical aspects of support delivery.

name: Customer Service Solutions
description: Keywords related to customer service software, solutions, and processes (including real-time support).

llm_rationales.authority: Strong foundational content. Similar to 'Software Support Channels', this expands the discussion of overall solutions.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Very relevant. Directly addresses the pain point of finding suitable solutions for customer support needs.

cluster_notes: Good cluster. Software integration is a recurring theme.

name: ITIL & Lifecycle Support
description: Keywords centering on ITIL frameworks, software lifecycle support, and ticketing systems.

llm_rationales.authority: Strong foundational content. ITIL provides a core knowledge base for understanding service management. This topic builds strong topical authority.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: ITIL is a framework, and while relevant to customer support, it's somewhat abstract. The connection to Donkey Support’s value proposition isn't immediately obvious to the ICP.

cluster_notes: Strong focus on IT service management practices.

name: Jira & IT Service
description: Keywords revolving around Jira Service Desk, IT service catalogs, and general SaaS support.

llm_rationales.authority: Good foundational topic. Demonstrates understanding of the broader software development ecosystem. However, it's not *directly* about the core value prop of integrated support across multiple platforms.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Jira is a common tool for software development teams, a key ICP segment. Understanding how support requests integrate with Jira addresses a pain point of managing complex support systems and context switching.

cluster_notes: Jira-focused, good specificity.

name: Support & CRM Integration
description: Keywords concerning CRM integration, technical support, and software solutions for customer service.

llm_rationales.authority: Adds depth to the cluster, showcasing awareness of broader customer data workflows. Supports the 'visitor context' in-scope topic.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: CRM integration is tangentially related. Donkey Support doesn’t *replace* a CRM, but integrating support data with a CRM is a use case.

cluster_notes: Good focus but slightly fragmented.  Could potentially merge with cluster 2

name: Company Support Contacts
description: Keywords used to find specific company support channels (e.g., Delta, Buyee).

llm_rationales.authority: Navigational intent, less about establishing expertise. Useful for capturing searches for specific company support pages but doesn’t build core knowledge.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Highly relevant. Directly addresses how users find support for specific platforms (NetSuite, Oracle), hinting at the need for a unified solution like Donkey Support.

cluster_notes: [needs_serp_validation] This is purely navigational. Each company should have its own dedicated resource, and this cluster should be broken down by brand.

name: Enterprise Support Platforms
description: Keywords revolving around enterprise-level help desk and CRM solutions, with integration aspects.

fit_reasons: Adaptive fallback promotion: included as secondary to avoid empty/too-small backlog.
Adaptive fallback promotion: included as secondary to avoid empty/too-small backlog.

llm_rationales.authority: Somewhat broad and competitive.  Establishing authority here will be challenging. More suited for capturing commercial intent.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Strong alignment. 'Enterprise help desk' speaks to a key ICP need (solving complex support) and aligns with the value proposition of automating and streamlining.

cluster_notes: Good cluster, but 'software as a service vs product' feels slightly out of place.

name: Service Desk Features
description: Keywords related to features of service desks, including self-service, AI, and ITIL frameworks.

llm_rationales.authority: Very High. Self-service is a key concept in modern customer support and deserves a thorough explainer.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: ‘Self-service support’ is a relevant feature, but it's a piece of the puzzle, not the whole solution. Focuses on a benefit, not the core product.

cluster_notes: Good, focused cluster.

name: IT Support & Management
description: Keywords covering IT help desk support, service management software, and automation aspects.

llm_rationales.authority: Good foundational topic. Broadly relevant to the ICP. Supports the 'Software Support Channels' topic.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: IT helpdesk support is directly related to the core offering, addressing a foundational need.

cluster_notes: Slightly broad, but IT-focused.

name: Company Support Contacts
description: Keywords used to find specific company support channels (e.g., CGI, Seagate).

llm_rationales.authority: Navigational intent.  Useful for capturing users searching for specific support contacts.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Similar to Topic 4, but focused on Oracle. High relevance as it addresses a specific customer support pain point.

cluster_notes: [needs_serp_validation] This is purely navigational. Each company should have its own dedicated resource, and this cluster should be broken down by brand.

name: Support Ticket & Pricing
description: Keywords relate to creating support tickets, help desk requests, and pricing for related services. There's a mix of specific platforms (Dynamics 365, ServiceNow, Order Desk, Once Human) and general terms.

fit_reasons: Adaptive fallback promotion: included as secondary to avoid empty/too-small backlog.
Adaptive fallback promotion: included as secondary to avoid empty/too-small backlog.

llm_rationales.authority: Moderate.  It doesn't *teach* anything about support, it assumes the user knows they need a ticket system. Better as a direct conversion driver.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Perfectly aligned. 'Create a support ticket' is core to what Donkey Support enables, as it is part of the support system. High commercial intent.

cluster_notes: [needs_serp_validation] This cluster appears to combine transactional keywords about creating support requests with pricing inquiries. A split into 'Support Request Processes' and 'Support Service Pricing' is recommended.

name: Field Service & Helpdesk
description: Keywords related to field service management, help desk software, and CRM integrations.

fit_reasons: Adaptive fallback promotion: included as secondary to avoid empty/too-small backlog.
Adaptive fallback promotion: included as secondary to avoid empty/too-small backlog.

llm_rationales.authority: Competitive. Establishing authority will require a unique perspective or deep dive. Better suited for commercial intent.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Field service and helpdesk are often combined, indicating a need for unified support solutions. Aligns with solving complex support systems.

cluster_notes: Strong cluster focused on specific software needs.

name: Software Support Channels
description: Keywords exploring the availability and quality of support for various software products, including response times.

fit_reasons: Adaptive fallback promotion: included as secondary to avoid empty/too-small backlog.
Adaptive fallback promotion: included as secondary to avoid empty/too-small backlog.

llm_rationales.authority: This is *the* foundational topic for the cluster. Every other topic will likely link to this. Highest potential for establishing authority.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Excellent alignment. 'Software support' is a direct descriptor of what Donkey Support provides. Addressing different channels speaks to a core benefit.

cluster_notes: Excellent cluster, highly focused on user support experiences.

name: Company Support Contacts
description: Keywords used to find specific company support channels (e.g., LiveAgent, Speco).

llm_rationales.authority: Good. Competitor-focused content can attract users actively searching for alternatives.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Dynamics 365 is another competitor. Similar to ServiceNow, this topic provides competitive context, but isn't central to Donkey Support's offering.

cluster_notes: [needs_serp_validation] This is purely navigational. Each company should have its own dedicated resource, and this cluster should be broken down by brand.

name: Support System Integration
description: Keywords focused on integrating support systems (Salesforce, Jira) and technical support details.

llm_rationales.authority: Adds depth but isn’t core. Salesforce integration could be a *future* feature, making this topic potentially valuable.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Salesforce integration is interesting, but Donkey Support focuses on post-sale support. The connection is less direct.

cluster_notes: Mix of integration queries and general support questions.

name: Company Support Contacts
description: Keywords used to find specific company support channels (e.g., Omnissa, Njoy).

llm_rationales.authority: Good. More niche competitor focus.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Similar to Topic 7, but focusing on a different product. Still relevant to the 'support' need.

cluster_notes: [needs_serp_validation] This is purely navigational. Each company should have its own dedicated resource, and this cluster should be broken down by brand.

name: Support Software & Automation
description: Keywords concerning customer support software, ticketing systems, and automation features, including comparisons.

fit_reasons: Adaptive fallback promotion: included as secondary to avoid empty/too-small backlog.
Adaptive fallback promotion: included as secondary to avoid empty/too-small backlog.

llm_rationales.authority: Good, but not foundational. It's a specific application of support automation.  It can build authority within that niche, but needs broader topics first.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Strongly aligned. 'IT service desk automation' directly addresses the pain points of target customers (slow response times, high costs) and fits with Donkey Support's automation capabilities.

cluster_notes: Includes some industry-specific (HVAC, Manufacturing) mentions, but these can likely be addressed within a broader software context.

name: ITSM & Support Systems
description: Keywords related to IT Service Management, ticketing systems, and general support automation.

llm_rationales.authority: Good foundational topic, similar to ITIL.  Helps establish a baseline understanding of service management principles.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: ITSM is related to support, but the core value of Donkey Support is simplicity and integration, not necessarily implementing a full ITSM suite.

cluster_notes: Strong focus on IT service management.

name: Company Support Contacts
description: Keywords used to find specific company support channels (e.g., Nintex, Icon).

fit_reasons: Adaptive fallback promotion: included as secondary to avoid empty/too-small backlog.
Adaptive fallback promotion: included as secondary to avoid empty/too-small backlog.

llm_rationales.authority: Good.  It's a bit more specific than a general service desk overview, making it a useful follow-up.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: Similar to Topic 2, ServiceNow is a competitor but understanding how users search for support within these systems is valuable.  Good alignment with the 'visitor context' in-scope item.

cluster_notes: [needs_serp_validation] This is purely navigational. Each company should have its own dedicated resource, and this cluster should be broken down by brand.

name: Help Desk & Software
description: Keywords around help desk services, software support processes, and self-service options.

llm_rationales.authority: Very High. Defines a foundational concept.
llm_rationales.business_alignment: ‘Tech help desk’ is a broad term. While relevant, it lacks specificity and doesn't immediately showcase Donkey Support’s unique value.

cluster_notes: Fairly broad, might benefit from more focused keywords.
